result.adr_address: улица Олега Ольжича, 4, Kyiv, Ukraine, 04086
result.name: Молоко від фермера

reviews.text: I constantly bought cakes and pies. But the last time I discovered a surprise in the form of a fly in an apple pie. Doubts have arisen about the quality of the product!!

We came with the expectation of making an order and eating at a table, but we were not allowed, arguing that it was quarantine and that the store was not a cafe! (Excuse me, why do you put tables if you are not a cafe?) To my question, 'Why were we able to sit yesterday, but no today” the quarantine was not introduced from today, they said something incomprehensible, and that I would have to pay a fine of 17 thousand, and the store 30. (Why such a conclusion was made, I did not understand, because They are fined for the lack of a certificate, and I have it) in short, in such a difficult time for everyone, I want to use my head and organize the work of my business adequately. And if for some reason you don’t want to serve customers, you need to explain this in an accessible form, without talking nonsense, and even better, provide information at the front door of the store!

Today I went to the store with my child and bought what I wanted. And the seller offers: “Do you want fresh croissants, still warm, just pulled out of the oven.” We agreed, bought it, and it was really warm. We came home, started drinking tea, and the croissants became crackers. Those. they were simply heated up, it is not known whether they were yesterday or the day before yesterday. Why deceive clients like this? We live in the same house and are regular customers. Such disrespect. Just to melt away the illiquid assets. These almond croissants cost 43 UAH, for 2-86 UAH. and no pleasure, half of it was thrown away. Very unpleasant, I don’t recommend the store.

The store is new. Basically this dairy chain is my favorite. But here is the branch on the street. Olzic leaves much to be desired. The staff is constantly changing, the staff is not experienced, they are very young guys. But the most unacceptable thing for me is the constant lack of fresh milk. It is very rare to have milk today. Mostly yesterday or the day before yesterday. Or it’s completely absent, or the pump doesn’t work, there’s been no sugar-free ice cream in a cardboard cup for a month now. In general, change the administrator and logistics. Overall the chain of stores is great.

Croissants are very tasty, but sometimes sellers confuse them and put them in a bag with the wrong filling that you order.
Once I bought kefir, it turned out to be very sour and tasteless, and it was also one day expired. For products that are generally considered natural, this is unacceptable. The last time I took the Napoleon cake, it was delicious, well soaked, but, apparently, it had already been standing and was saturated with the smell of the store, which spoiled its aftertaste.
I won't buy again
